alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 10:22AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following county, Hunterdon. * WHEN...Until 115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated up to an inch of rainfall. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area, mainly right along the Neshanic River. - Little additional rainfall is expected, and the Neshanic River will likely crest by midday today, and fall back below flood stage early this afternoon. - For Neshanic at Reaville: At 10:15am the stage was 6.46 feet. Flood Stage is 6.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
